result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brianna L. Hoople

records.addlTxt: Letter to Judge re: bond reduction

11:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brianna L. Hoople appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Breanna Magallones for Brianna L. Hoople appeared in court. Calling 22CF53, 21CM203, 22CM23 & 22CM42. 22CF53 set for a preliminary hearing. State calls Oneida County Sheriffs Deputy Michael Barron/sworn/direct by Pfeifer/witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Pfeifer/cross by Magallones/witness is excused. State calls Oneida County Sheriff's Deputy Alyssa Knabenbauer/sworn/direct by Pfeifer/witness is excused. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. Pfeifer requests a separate arraignment date. Magallones filed motion to modify bond. Pfeifer/Magallones statement to bond. Court will set $1000 signature bond in 21CM203. Bonds continue in other cases. adj. 11:36 PM
Arraignment scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brianna L. Hoople appeared by video, in custody. Breanna Magallones appears on behalf of defendant.
Calling 21cm203,22cm23,22cm42 (PTC) and 22cf53 for AIA  Will be appointed to represent.
In Receipt, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - Time limits not waived.- other cases will be set for status
Bail continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 11:15 am. -

1:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brianna L. Hoople appeared in court, in custody,  Brianna Magallones appears on behalf of Defendant.
Calling 21cm203,22cm23 and 22cm42.
In receipt of new complaint in 22cm42, waive reading - not guilty plea, may be filing motion in regards to count 3.
Prior offer rescinded due to new complaint- request new PTC for all 3 cases.
Bail continued in all 3 cases.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brianna L. Hoople appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Breanna Magallones appeared in court for Brianna L. Hoople. Calling 21CM203 & 22CM23. Pfeifer state cases are not resolved yet. Magallones has no objection to set out - statement to bond. Pfeiffer statement to bond. Defendant statement to Lincoln County Court bond. adj. 02:56 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 11:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brianna L. Hoople appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones appearing by video. Magallones will be representing. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Magallones statement to treatment - will provide order to JA. Bail continued. adj.11:37 AM Pretrial Conference Scheduled February 8, 2022 at 2:30 PM

1:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brianna L. Hoople appeared by video, in custody. 
Court questions defendant - she has contacted PD's office  multiple times.  Court will contact PD 's office after court today. 
Defendant request sig bond.  Pfeifer to bail - Court statement - continues bond as set but would modify if bed becomes to available.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Letter to Court re: bond reduction
Absolutely no contact whatsoever with K.L.H. dob 5/22/96.

1:33 PM Attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears via audio visual zoom - from ONSO.  Atty Svehlek appears via audio visual zoom for defendant and states is eligible for PD and believes Atty Magallones will more than likely be appointed.  ADA Pfeifer statement to bond/Atty Svehlek statement. Defendant statement to court.  Court sets cash bond of $750.00 with conditions of absolutely no contact whatsoever with K.L.H. dob 05/22/96
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
